channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump to assess Texas flood damage today. And, DOGE has access to farmers' payments
item.description: President Trump is heading to Texas to assess the damage caused by the recent flooding. DOGE has access to a database that controls government payment...

item.title: Next time you see a vulture picking over a carcass, say 'thank you!'
item.description: Large scavengers like vultures and hyenas do an important job in protecting human health. But studies show these creatures are on the decline, allowin...

item.title: Part war propaganda, part comic strip, Bayeux Tapestry to return to U.K.
item.description: On a state visit, France's president announced the loan of the tapestry embroidered with scenes of the 1066 Norman invasion. It will return to the U.K...

item.title: Hundreds laid off in State Department overhaul
item.description: The State Department is slashing hundreds of jobs in what's being called its biggest shake-up in decades â€” drawing sharp criticism from former diploma...

item.title: Sumy, a center of Ukrainian culture, lives in the crosshairs of a new Russian offensive
item.description: The northern regional capital has become a frequent target of Russian drones, missiles and guided bombs. Now, Ukraine's top general says at least 50,0...

item.title: How Medicaid cuts in the GOP budget bill could impact maternity care and families
item.description: Medicaid helps pay for 41% of births in the U.S., according to Kaiser Family Foundation. In rural communities, it covers nearly half. President Trump'...

item.title: Megan Piphus on her first solo album
item.description: Megan Piphus, known for ventriloquism and as Gabrielle on "Sesame Street," is out with a new children's album called "Cinderella Sweep." Her songs cov...

item.title: Iran could recover some enriched uranium after US strikes, Israeli official says
item.description: The US has insisted that Iran's nuclear facilities were completely 'obliterated' during strikes in June.

item.title: More than 150 arrests in global human trafficking crackdown
item.description: Thousands of potential victims are identified in operation involving 15,000 officers from 43 countries.

item.title: Nigeria has 'enough problems' and can't take deportees from US, minister says
item.description: Nigeria cannot accept Venezuelans because "we already have over 230 million people," says the foreign minister.

item.title: Tick bites are causing a spike in ER visits this year. Experts explain why.
item.description: Emergency room visits for tick bites this year are at the highest levels since 2019, especially in the Northeast, according to data from the Centers f...

item.title: Kurdish PKK burns guns in cauldron in big step towards ending Turkey conflict
item.description: The ceremony took place under tight security at a cave in Iraqi Kurdistan - the disarmament process is expected to last all summer.

item.title: Ukraine to receive US air defence systems, says Trump
item.description: The US president says he will sell weapons to Nato, which would then give them to Ukraine.

item.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (July 13)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the Emmy-winning program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

item.title: How Trump's "big, beautiful bill" affects student loans
item.description: New law reduces the number of federal student loan repayment options and caps how much individuals can borrow for higher education.

item.title: Head Start will be cut off for immigrants without legal status, Trump administration says
item.description: The Trump administration says it will restrict immigrants in the country illegally from enrolling in Head Start, a federally funded preschool program.

item.title: Mourning begins in Texas where more than 170 are still missing from flash floods
Warning sirens helped this small Texas community survive flooding
